subject: Re: [junit] Using parallel computer in JUnit 4.6
msgSnippet: I did make a change based around this, but I m not completely happy with it. I feel like you would want to use the timeout version of the API; e.g. for CI
messageBody:
I did make a change based around this, but I'm not completely happy
with it. I feel like you would want to use the timeout version of the
API; e.g. for CI servers not to hang waiting for a bad test to
complete. Maybe an annotation or similar could be used to pass an
maxTime value in, otherwise it defaults to something reasonable like 2
minutes? Unfortunately, I'm not so familiar with the 4.x codebase, so
I'm not sure whether that's a good suggestion.

2009/5/1 David Saff <david@...>:

> On Thu, Apr 30, 2009 at 1:25 PM, mghongslo <mghongslo@...> wrote:
>> I'm reviewing the experimental functionality of running parallel tests at
>> the class level; i.e. Parallel.classes(), I notice in the ParallelComputer
>> class, run() method there is a call get with a timeout for 2000
>> milliseconds. Is there a significant reason for this versus get() without
>> any timeout? In conducting test without JUnit test cases, I'm finding this
>> timeout feature creates timeout exceptions whereas running JUnit without the
>> timeout allows my test to run successfully. Can anyone explain why this
>> timeout is needed?
